metadata.title: The History of the Patent System under the Prerogative and at Common Law

relevance.topic: History of the English Patent System
relevance.relevance: The study provides a historical analysis of the English patent system, highlighting the role of patents in promoting new industries and inventions, which is relevant to understanding labor displacement due to technological change.

qualitative_data.narrative_descriptions: The study describes the historical development of the English patent system, focusing on how the Crown used patents to promote new industries and the eventual shift in responsibility to patentees.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Transition from a pastoral and mining society to a more industrialized economy.
historical_context.institutional_context: The Crown played a significant role in granting patents to promote new industries, which later evolved into a more structured patent system.

outcomes.main_findings: The English patent system evolved from Crown-granted monopolies to a more structured system that encouraged the introduction of new industries.
outcomes.conclusions: The study concludes that the patent system played a crucial role in industrial development by promoting new industries, which had significant economic impacts.
